reviews.review_msg: Ehor Boyanowsky is a god amongst men. A ram amongst sheep. A titan amongst the meek. His lectures are enthralling, and those who fail to understand them are simply ignorant of true genius. I highly recommend taking a classany classwith Dr. Boyanowksy.

Useless class. Completely disorganized and unstructured. Did not follow course outline, we didn't even know when to do the readings so ended up doing nothing in class but listen to him talk. Do not take this class if you want to learn anything other than the prof's life stories.
He'll offend you if you don't have a sense of humour. Be engaged and ask him questions about his previous research and experiences. Great professor overall.

Useless course. There was no real lecture entire class was based on his debates with his "fan club". He was way too politically charged and unwilling to consider other perspectives. If all you want is an easy "A" or "B" take his class... but this honestly shouldn't be your reason for pursuing post-secondary...

Useless course. There was no real lecture entire class was based on his debates with his "fan club". He was way to politically charged and unwilling to consider other perspectives. If all you want is an easy "A" or "B" take his class... but this honestly shouldn't be your reason for pursuing post-secondary...

Easy upper level elective course. Only need to do a presentation and midterm then that's it! Not even a take home final is required. Participation is mandatory. Ehor is interesting and talks about his personal experience a lot. Recommended!

Ehor is a very intelligent man who has decades of experience within the field. I often felt he was too knowledgeable to teach this course, or didn't want to. I liked him a lot as a professor but he did none of his own marking. He did not even provide TA's with marking expectations for MT. The TA's he had (Hilary) were awful. Final was random...
He was a great prof. But his TA were no good. The material was really good and came right from the textbook. Midterm fair, but the TA didn't mark fairly! Final m/c fair. An easy B class.

His lectures are interesting and he stuck almost word for word to the textbook he wrote himself. I loved the material so I enjoyed going to class. The midterm was fair and if you spent just a day studying you could easily get a B. The final is a different story. It is extremely difficult. Content of the course is awesome. His teaching is average.
a great guy and great prof. I found this a great elective course to take that was super interesting.

He's a very interesting person with lots of interesting story, but is a horrible lecturer. He often goes off on tangets and his powerpoints make no sense. You never know what to study for the exams, which are all over the place. His TAs are also hard markers. Would not reconmend taking 103 with him.

He is a brilliant person and researcher. His work is really commendable and interesting. But i hope we used some textbook to refer to. It's like i don't know where to study from. I like him as a person. I just wish he was a better professor.

Worst professor I've ever had at SFU, hands down.  No textbook to refer to, and trying to study his lectures is torture considering how often he went off topic and rambled on and on.  He might be a fun person, but he wasn't a good professor. Stay away from this class!

Very interesting course. Dr. Boyanowsky brings flavour into this course with his experience and expertise. Like the previous review, I also could not keep a straight face in class. Not sure why he is getting low marks but he is the man!!!
Boyanowsky is the man. He is hilarious, I couldnt keep a straight face during class.

I like Ehor as a person, but as a lecturer he falls short. It's nice to hear history stories, etc., but not if it means students aren't taught proper course content. Class average on the midterm was 67%...and for one tutorial it was 57%. I would not recommend taking this class solely because unfortunately the lectures are very disorganized, although the Prof seems nice.

though many people said his courses are fun and easy but i must agree with the person that just posted he did infact tried new textbooks and his age does seem to get better of him as rambles about topics like fishing during lectures
Nice guy. very interesting lectures... his midterm was tough. Know your theories! Final is so random...

If you have a chance to take one of his upper division seminar courses, seize the opportunity. He only grades on one paper and one presentation and he marks fairly easy provided that you write well and you capture the essence of the issues. Wonderful teacher.

i loved this course! .. Boyanowsky is a great professor, make sure you attend his lectures and take great notes, otherwise you will not succeed .. his midterm was a little difficult but if you take good notes, then you'll do great-->they are based on his lecture notes ..& as for the final, most of the ?'s come from the textbook .& titi is a good TA
I am going to touch (twice) my female teacher assistant and show you guys what is an assault.Come on seriously. Do we really need to go that far.
I am going to touch (twice) my sexy female assistant and show you guys what is an assault. Come on seriously Ehor!

The Professor has a lot of experience probably too much for a teacher. The problem is when a teacher gets old they start to take thing not seriously like once he came in class and said he forgot his lecture notes on his desk. Also he himself said he was not prepared for this semester because he used to have 80 students in his class.

He's a good, interesting professor. He tells good stories and keeps the lectures engaging and entertaining. His midterms are a big hard. The TA Jessica Field is very very helpful and gives outlines for the exams and sends out a lot of study questions. He is a hard marker but if you study and take thorough notes during lecture you will do well.

Oh yeah. And Titi doesn't seem comfortable in her position. Nice girl, but not, NOT, a good TA. If you ask her questions, she'll tell you to re-read your textbook, or look up the answer on the internet.

Anyone that complains about Ehor going off topic is a boring, dry student without much soul in their bones. Boyanowsky tells the greatest stories, and all of them have to do with the material, and you will REMEMBER everything he teaches. He doesn't use slide shows, he just talks, and he knows his stuff. You'll want to buy this man a beer.

He was so much fun! I enjoyed the lectures as well as the course material. There's quite a bit of content so students actually have to read the textbooks and take notes. I think people are only harsh on him because he's a fair marker and rewards hard work over giving out free grades.

This is the best and easiest siminar class ever! Boyanowsky makes the class very interesting, and his great sense of humor helped as well. There were only one exam, which he graded super easy. The whole class really enjoyed him as a prof.

hav to attend lectures!! mt was easy.. but soo much 2 write & its 30% textbook n the rest on his lectures.. so take good notes! p.s. only a very simple outline available n the ta, titi.. shes just.. >.> bad ta

Ehor is a nice guy. He can go off topic a lot and important information doesn't get covered. But overall a pretty decent guy. Titi is the only TA and she is brutal. She doesn't listen and can't answer questions, her english is poor. She marked the midterm based on her knowledge and notes from lecture, the prof gave no marking scheme.

Boyhanowsky seems scattered in his lectures. He doesn't relate anything to hi readings. You do not have to attend lecture, just read the longgg chapters of the text and you should be okay. Titi was his only TA, she doesnt seem to get along with anyone. so watch your back with her. Her english wasnt very good and she had a hard time remembering name

His lecture is very interesting however it's not related to the readings. There are so much readings to do including tutorial reading. Oh, if your TA is TiTi, change it!! She doesn't speak any English, nor know any course materials..if you ask her any questions, she will tell you to google it up or use wikipedia. Exam is both from lecture and readi

Lectures are very interesting, listening to them again online is a must! Text book is boring,and although sometimes unclear, it does tie in well with the lectures! Not lecturing the book however, but they both work together! I had TiTi as my TA, although her English isn't great, she puts in time and effort and she was fine. She was kind of cute.

Overhead outline + Listen to records online = good. Not very organize with the reading though, did not bother to correct the errors on reading list till 1 week before midterm. A good speaker in class though, very clear.

He's a great teacher! He's fun to listen to class, and entertaining. Though his lectures may not always have to do with the textbook, but it's still helpful, and he even says it himself. The material is interesting, and if you get Holly as your TA - she's just great! I loved this class. Great prof! =)

he doesnt go over anything from the textbook..!! his lectures are fun to listen to..but reading the long chapters? and TAs are the worst of all..I dont think they know what they are teaching, the questions that we go over at tutorials dont even come out in the exams..!!oh, if you see TiTi as TA, dont ever take that class, she doesnt know english
No Comments

One of the best at SFU, extremely compelling seminar, wonderful and insightful! Raises controversial issues that other profs are afraid to touch! Can't say enough great things about this class! Professor Boyanowsky is one of the best at SFU!
